message.content:
1. A study was conducted comparing costs between a home-based group and another group.
2. The difference in cost per patient was €3160 in favour of the home-based group.
3. This difference was statistically non-significant.
4. The 95% confidence interval for this difference was from -460 to 6780.
5. The p-value for this difference was 0.09.
6. The probability that the home-based group was more cost-effective varied between 97% and 75%.
7. The willingness-to-pay was €0 for a 97% probability of cost-effectiveness.
8. The willingness-to-pay was €100,000 for a 75% probability of cost-effectiveness.
9. The cost-effectiveness was measured in terms of quality-adjusted life-years.

messages.content:
Statement: From a societal perspective, a statistically non-significant difference of €3160 per patient in favour of the home-based group was found (95% confidence interval –460 to 6780, p = 0.09) and the probability that it was more cost-effective varied between 97% and 75% (willingness-to-pay of €0 and €100,000 per quality-adjusted life-years, respectively).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
